property.name: AJAX Auto-complete Limit
property.description: The maximum number of items to show when making suggestions for auto-complete.

property.name: Auto Update Criteria
property.description: For supporting criteria updates search instantly

property.default-value: docx, docm, dotx, dotm, xlsx, xlsm, xltx, xltm, xlsb, xlam, pptx, pptm, potx, potm, ppam, ppsx, ppsm, sldx, sldm, thmx, odt, odp, ods, odg, odb, odf, ott, otp, ots, otg, odm, sxw, stw, sxc, stc, sxi, sti, sxd, std, sxg

property.name: Maximum number of zip entries to display
property.description: The contents of zip attachments can be displayed, but often there are too many to display.

property.name: The prefix added to the Summary field of cloned issues
Date Picker Format (Java)
property.description: This part is only for the Java (server side) generated dates. Note that this should correspond to the javascript date picker format (jira.date.picker.javascript.format) setting.

property.name: Date Picker Format (JavaScript)
property.description: This part is only for the JavaScript (client side) generated dates. Note that this should correspond to the java date picker format (jira.date.picker.java.format) setting.

property.name: DateTime Picker Format (Java)
property.description: This part is only for the Java (server side) generated datetimes. Note that this should correspond to the javascript datetime picker format (jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format) setting.

property.name: DateTime Picker Format (JavaScript)
property.description: This part is only for the JavaScript (client side) generated date times. Note that this should correspond to the java datetime picker format (jira.date.time.picker.java.format) setting.
The number of items to fetch from the database into memory at a time. The default setting of -1 will stream the values on MySQL and use a fetch size of 1000 on other databases.
The maximum number of elements allowed on the queue before the XML parser waits for the database to catch up
How many threads to use for multi-threaded insertion of imported data
The maximum number of elements allowed on the queue before blocking on queue submission
Minimum size of a batch that will cause the operation to become multi-threaded
How many threads to use for multi-threaded indexing of issues
The maximum number of elements allowed on the queue before blocking on queue submission
Minimum size of a batch that will cause the operation to become multi-threaded
How many threads to use for multi-threaded indexing of shared entities (things that are favourited and/or shared)

When IndexWriter.expungeDeletes is called, a segment that has higher than this percentage of deleted documents will be merged away. Currently, JIRA does not use this method itself, but a plug-in could.

The TieredMergePolicy tries to merge together index segments that are roughly the same size. This setting tells it to ignore size differences for segments that are smaller than this, allowing all small segments to be candidates for merging.
The maximum number of segment files that can be simultaneously merged into a single larger segment during normal internal merging.
This value is used instead of jira.index.mergepolicy.maxmergeatonce when the merge is explicitly requested using IndexWriter.optimize or IndexWriter.expungeDeletes

This is the largest size for any single segment of the index to reach. Lucene's default is 5120, which means 5GB segment files and slow merges so it is reduced, here. Setting it too low slows down searches and rrisks too many open files at once.

Controls what percentage of the total index size a segment can reach and still be a candidate for merging into the compound file format, which combines term dictionaries, frequencies, and so forth into a single file instead of individual ones. Smaller means more files and slower searching; larger means fewer but larger files and probably slower writes.

A balancing factor that controls the number of segments that are permitted at each tier, meaning indexes that are roughly equivalent in size. With the default setting, it would be ok to have 9 segments that are 8MB each, but when a 10th is created, it would trigger 2 or more of them to be combined, which would move them up to a larger tier.
An on/off switch for the use of the compound file format. This is usually a good thing to use and probably shouldn't be switched off.
The number of issues to read from the database at once during background indexing.

property.name: JIRA issue actions order
property.description: The default order of actions (tab items like 'Comments', 'Change History' etc) on the 'View Issue' screen, by date, from top to bottom.

property.name: Text Colour on Highlight in the header
XSRF security measures
property.description: Controls whether XSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) security token protection is enabled in JIRA. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery for more information.

property.name: Database Transaction Support
property.description: Controls the ability to turn off database transaction support. Only do so if directed to by Atlassian Support.

property.name: Allow users to be renamed even when JIRA is acting as a Crowd server
property.description: Controls whether or not the ability to rename a user is enabled when JIRA is configured to act as a Crowd server. Some client applications depending on JIRA's Crowd server implementation may misinterpret a renamed user as having been deleted and created anew, in which case you can use this flag to disallow renames in JIRA.
For how many months should audit log entries be retained. Negative value means indefinitely
Unix timestamp saying when the last change of auditing retention period was made. Value of zero means no change yet.

property.name: JIRA project key pattern
property.description: A regular expression that defines a valid project key.

property.default-value: PRN, AUX, CLOCK$, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, CON, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, LPT9

property.name: JIRA subtasks table columns
property.description: The columns to show when viewing sub-task issues in a table

property.name: Sort order for view issue links
property.description: Specifies the sort order of the issue links on the 'View Issue' screen.
The maximum number of characters to be entered for a single field. Affects Description, Environment and Comments.
Enables or disables built-in GZIP compression for web requests
Disables outgoing emails from JIRA.
Disables fetching incoming emails in JIRA.
The number of Issues to include in a stable search
The number of issues to keep in the browser cache
The minimum number of comments needing to be hidden for comment collapsing to occur. 0 means there will be no comment collapsing.
Verification key for Google Webmaster Tools
